articles.description: All the latest news as Sarina Wiegman names her England squad for the 2025 Women's European Championships.
articles.title: Wiegman to name England squad for Euro 2025 - build-up and latest

articles.description: England recall Jacob Bethell for the first Test against India and respond to a lengthy pace-bowling injury list by naming Jamie Overton in the squad.
articles.title: England v India: Jacob Bethell and Jamie Overton in squad for first Test

articles.description: Russell Martin is "not going to make any promises" after becoming Rangers' new head coach, but insists they must "win early and win while developing".
articles.title: Rangers: Russell Martin 'won't make promises' but new manager must win early

articles.description: Ousmane Dembele and Lamine Yamal, the two favourites for the Ballon d'Or, go head to head in Thursday's Nations League semi-final.
articles.title: Lamine Yamal and Ousmane Dembele: Ballon d'Or rivals meet in Spain v France

articles.description: Several Premier League clubs made offers to sign Ipswich striker Liam Delap - so why has he opted for Chelsea?
articles.title: Liam Delap: How Chelsea won the race to sign £30m striker from Ipswich

articles.description: The French Open gears up for Iga Swiatek - the reigning champion - against world number one Aryna Sabalenka in the women's semi-finals.
articles.title: French Open 2025: Iga Swiatek v Aryna Sabalenka semi-final preview

articles.description: When Cristiano Ronaldo scored the winner in Portugal's Nations League semi-final against Germany, he completed a rare career first.
articles.title: Cristiano Ronaldo: Portugal legend finally beats Germany

articles.description: With the transfer window open, BBC Sport takes a look at which strikers across Europe could be moving in the next few months.
articles.title: Strikers who will be in demand this summer: Sesko, Mbeumo, Ekitike, Guirassy, Gyokores, Mateta, Watkins

articles.description: England opener Phil Salt will miss the T20 series against West Indies on paternity leave and has been replaced in the squad by Jamie Smith.
articles.title: England v West Indies: England opener Phil Salt to miss T20 series on paternity leave

articles.description: World number 361 Lois Boisson continues her fairytale French Open with a straight-set quarter-final win over sixth seed Mirra Andreeva.
articles.title: French Open 2025 results: Wildcard Lois Boisson reaches semi-finals with win over Mirra Andreeva
